mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Entrepreneurs write business proposals, quotations, contracts, complaint responses, and marketing content daily. Clear writing wins clients, poor writing loses opportunities. Grammar errors in proposals make business look unprofessional.
mappings.example_scenario: Writing business proposal: 'Dear Sir/Madam, I am pleased to offer you 100 bags of cement at GHS 75 per bag, total GHS 7,500. Delivery within 3 days. Payment terms: 50% deposit, balance on delivery. Yours faithfully...' Clear structure, correct grammar, professional tone = client trusts you.
mappings.required_for: Proposals, contracts, business letters, marketing materials, loan applications, customer communication

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Business success depends on clear communication: negotiating with suppliers, pitching to investors, training staff, handling customer complaints. Listening carefully to customer needs is how you identify opportunities. Speaking confidently closes deals.
mappings.example_scenario: Negotiating with supplier: Listen to their offer ('GHS 100 per item'), identify problem ('too expensive'), respond clearly ('Can you do GHS 80 for bulk order of 500 items?'), listen to counteroffer, negotiate until agreement. Poor communication = no deal.
mappings.required_for: Sales presentations, negotiations, customer service, staff management, networking, investor pitches

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Nurses write patient notes, medication reports, incident reports, and care plans. Errors in writing can cause treatment mistakes. Clear documentation protects patients and nurses legally. Every action must be recorded precisely.
mappings.example_scenario: Patient note: 'Patient complained of headache at 10:30am. Vital signs: BP 120/80, Temp 37.2°C, Pulse 78. Administered Paracetamol 500mg as prescribed. Headache resolved by 11:15am.' Clear, precise, professional writing = good care record.
mappings.required_for: Patient documentation, medical reports, care plans, incident reports, professional communication

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Nurses must listen carefully to patient symptoms (miss one word = wrong diagnosis), explain treatment clearly (patient must understand to follow instructions), and communicate with doctors precisely (miscommunication = medical error).
mappings.example_scenario: Patient says: 'My chest hurts when I breathe deeply.' Nurse must: 1) Listen carefully (chest pain = serious), 2) Ask clarifying questions ('Where exactly? How long?'), 3) Explain clearly to doctor, 4) Explain treatment to patient in simple terms they understand.
mappings.required_for: Patient assessment, doctor-nurse communication, patient education, emergency response, family counseling

mappings.subject: Creative Arts and Design
mappings.real_world_application: CORE SKILL. All design starts with drawing - sketching logo ideas, planning layouts, creating compositions. Understanding proportion, balance, and visual hierarchy learned through drawing applies directly to digital design.
mappings.example_scenario: Designing company logo: First sketch multiple ideas on paper (drawing skills). Choose best concept. Refine proportions (visual arts training). Consider balance and symmetry. Then recreate digitally in Canva/Photoshop. Without drawing foundation, designs look unprofessional.
mappings.required_for: Logo design, layout planning, visual composition, client presentations, concept development

mappings.subject: Creative Arts and Design
mappings.real_world_application: Color makes or breaks design. Wrong colors = message fails. Understanding color psychology (red = energy, blue = trust), color harmony, and cultural meanings is essential. Every poster, logo, brand uses intentional color choices.
mappings.example_scenario: Bank logo design: Use blue (trust, stability) + green (money, growth). NEVER use red (danger, debt). Restaurant poster: Use warm colors (red, orange, yellow) to stimulate appetite. Funeral program: Use black, white, subdued colors (respect, solemnity). Color knowledge = effective design.
mappings.required_for: Brand identity, marketing materials, color scheme selection, emotional impact, cultural appropriateness

mappings.subject: Creative Arts and Design
mappings.real_world_application: Fashion designers MUST draw. Every garment starts as sketch: design ideas, show clients, communicate with tailors. Drawing skills learned in JHS are foundation for fashion illustration. Can't design fashion without drawing ability.
mappings.example_scenario: Client wants custom dress: Designer sketches multiple designs showing different styles, necklines, lengths. Client chooses favorite. Designer draws detailed pattern with measurements. Tailor follows drawing to create dress. No drawing ability = can't design fashion.
mappings.required_for: Fashion illustration, pattern design, client presentations, trend boards, portfolio creation

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Developers read technical documentation, error messages, code comments, and programming tutorials daily. Strong reading = learning new technologies quickly. Weak reading = constantly stuck, can't solve problems independently.
mappings.example_scenario: Error message appears: 'TypeError: undefined is not a function at line 42.' Developer must READ carefully, understand each word, search documentation, read solutions online, comprehend technical explanations. Poor reading skills = can't debug effectively.
mappings.required_for: Reading documentation, understanding error messages, learning new languages, code review, technical research

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Developers write code comments, documentation, bug reports, and technical emails. Clear writing helps team understand code. Poor writing = nobody understands your work, code becomes unmaintainable. Professional developers write clearly.
mappings.example_scenario: Code comment: 'This function calculates user age from birth date. It accounts for leap years and returns integer.' vs unclear comment: 'does age thing'. Good writing = teammates understand code. Bad writing = code is mystery, hard to maintain.
mappings.required_for: Code documentation, bug reports, technical specifications, team communication, user manuals

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: THIS IS THE JOB. Journalists write news articles, reports, features daily. Grammar errors = loss of credibility. Unclear writing = readers don't understand news. Structure matters: who, what, when, where, why. Writing ability determines career success.
mappings.example_scenario: News article structure: 'Accra, Jan 5 - Fire destroyed three shops at Makola Market yesterday evening. No injuries reported. Ghana Fire Service responded within 15 minutes. Market traders estimate GHS 500,000 in losses. Investigation ongoing.' Clear, factual, grammatically correct = professional journalism.
mappings.required_for: News writing, feature articles, reports, interviews, headlines, social media posts, investigations

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Journalists interview people, present news on TV/radio, ask tough questions, understand complex answers. Listening carefully catches important details. Speaking clearly delivers news professionally. Communication skills ARE journalism skills.
mappings.example_scenario: Interview scenario: Politician claims 'We built 100 schools.' Journalist must: Listen critically, ask follow-up ('Where exactly? When completed? What's your evidence?'), speak clearly when presenting story, challenge unclear answers. Poor listening = miss the real story.
mappings.required_for: Conducting interviews, radio/TV presentation, press conferences, investigating stories, questioning sources

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Journalists read government documents, reports, research papers, competing news articles to verify facts and find stories. Strong reading = understanding complex issues quickly. Critical reading = spotting inconsistencies and lies.
mappings.example_scenario: Reading government budget document (100 pages): Journalist must quickly find key information, understand financial terms, identify important changes, spot potential controversies, cross-reference with previous budgets. Strong reading skills = finding the real story buried in documents.
mappings.required_for: Research, fact-checking, document analysis, background reading, investigative reporting, verification

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Teaching IS communication. Speaking clearly so students understand, listening to student questions/problems, explaining concepts multiple ways. Teachers who can't communicate clearly confuse students. Clear speech = effective teaching.
mappings.example_scenario: Teaching math: Speak clearly ('Today we learn multiplication. Multiplication means repeated addition. 3 × 4 means 3 groups of 4.'). Listen when student says 'I don't understand' - identify exactly what's confusing. Explain differently. Check understanding by asking questions. Communication = teaching success.
mappings.required_for: Lesson delivery, explaining concepts, classroom management, parent meetings, student counseling, professional development

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Teachers write lesson plans, student reports, parent communications, exam questions, and feedback daily. Clear writing helps students learn. Grammar errors = students learn incorrectly. Professional writing = respect from parents and administration.
mappings.example_scenario: Student report card: 'Kwame shows strong improvement in mathematics. He completed 85% of assignments on time and participates actively in class discussions. Recommendation: Continue practice with word problems.' vs 'Kwame good in maths.' Professional writing = parents trust teacher.
mappings.required_for: Lesson planning, report cards, parent communication, exam creation, feedback, educational records

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Law IS reading. Lawyers read contracts, laws, court decisions, legal documents constantly. Every word matters - missing one word in contract can cost millions. Critical reading finds loopholes and arguments. Speed-reading processes volumes of material daily.
mappings.example_scenario: Contract says: 'Payment due within 30 days of invoice.' Lawyer reads carefully: 'within' means up to 30 days, not on day 30. Client asks about late payment - lawyer re-reads contract to find exact clause, interprets correctly, advises client. Misreading = bad legal advice = client loses money.
mappings.required_for: Contract review, legal research, case law study, document analysis, finding precedents, due diligence

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Lawyers write contracts, legal briefs, court motions, client letters. Every word must be precise - ambiguous writing creates legal problems. Grammar errors undermine credibility in court. Professional writing = winning cases.
mappings.example_scenario: Writing contract clause: 'The seller shall deliver goods by December 31, 2025' (clear) vs 'Seller might deliver goods around end of year' (unclear, unenforceable). Precise writing protects client. Vague writing = legal disputes.
mappings.required_for: Contract drafting, court filings, legal briefs, client correspondence, legal opinions, agreements

mappings.subject: English Language
mappings.real_world_application: Lawyers argue cases in court, interview clients/witnesses, negotiate settlements, present to judges. Speaking persuasively wins cases. Listening carefully catches contradictions in testimony. Communication ability determines courtroom success.
mappings.example_scenario: Court presentation: Lawyer must speak clearly, confidently, persuasively to judge. Listen carefully when opponent speaks - catch errors in their argument. Question witness, listen to answers, identify inconsistencies. Strong communication = winning argument.
mappings.required_for: Court argumentation, client consultation, witness examination, negotiations, legal presentations, mediation
